You have fun. But... overall i could not play this game without getting frustration, bugs, and a feeling that a lot of things have been disregarded. This game does not feel finished at all, graphics requirements are extremely high for the resulting outputs, bugs happen, and the communication with every other player is so limited. If you don't have friends to play with you will really feel alone.
The progress you make is VERY slow :  getting new character, perks, or skins either require 5euro on an equivalent of 100hour of game... 
Only one kind of game is possible (ranked like)
And, you can typically get five minutes waiting times for ONE game. Which may last three minutes...

I like it globally but it could be so much better

Dead by Daylight is a pretty fun game, but be ready for a fairly mean community if you want to get into this game.
The game can be pretty intense and as you play more and learn it gets pretty exciting as you perfect either your road runner skills or your coyote antics.

Would recommend but be sure to turn of the postgame chat as people are slightly toxic.

Some may say that this game is full of bugs and strange things, and they may be right, but what makes a good game? I think a good game has to be funny, interactive, challenging and changing, and this game has all of that. Wanna play alone? Play as one of the many killers, each with their own special ability and strategy. Wanna play with your friends? Create a Survive With Friends (SFW) team and try to outplay the killer and escape the trial. Make the most out of your abilities and the map. And, especially, "mind game" the killer (or the survivors if you're the killer). That's the most interesting aspect of the game: you play against other human beings and you can and will "mind game" them into thinking something different to what you're gonna do. And when that works, you'll feel great.

I've played 2000+ hours of this game (some people have played +7000 hours) and it's always challenging, be it playing as killer or as survivor. Besides, even though we can say almost anything about the developers, we cannot deny that they put content out regularly (this game was release in 2006). They're doing a pretty good job so far (pun intended).

At first, you'll be hiding like a coward, and that's fine. Then, terror and fear will be out of the way (except with certain killer, that can make you jump even if you have 5000 hours into the game) and you will be able to concentrate on the mechanics. Enjoy the game, try to learn from the experts (go to Twitch to check some good channels) and play BOTH roles; I think that's the best advice I can give you. You'll probably prefer playing killler (I'm a killer main, for example) or survivor, but I'd encourage you to play both roles to know how both roles think.

But most of all, enjoy the game, the chases and the mindgames. And don't forget to type "GG" at the end of the game and avoid being a dick with flishlights and t-bags. We all want to have fun :)

Amazing game so far i just got on pc (I have had it on ps4 since release). It has amazing graphics, Amazing gameplay, It's fun, There has not been a time i have played dead by daylight without letting out a laugh or two,  Especially when with friends.
Overall a good game, good enough solo gameplay. The hitboxes of objects and of your character can feel very rough and thus very bad at times.

I played this game not nearly long enough to be an absolute god at it, but I played it enough to review it respectively.
At first, it feels like a horror game, a terrible killer is chasing you down, you heart pounding and scared to shit from his looks, his red stain and bloody way of hurting you. 
Yea, that fades rather quickly. Aside from a few jumpscares from certain killers because they have no terror radius (in other words, there is no notification that they are closing in on you before it is too late), the horror aspect is pretty much gone and it turns into a game of mind games, mechanics and understanding the flow of the game. Which I love. And while it does this, it never feels too competitive, because at the end of the day, it isn't. It is just a casual game that mixes luck with skill well enough to give you the best of both worlds. You can try hard and hope to succeed with luck either supporting or disadvantaging your journey or you can just go in to have fun and do exactly that, especially with friends.
Overall I really enjoy this game so far, I never play it for too long but it is definitely a keeper so far
With perks like monstrous shrine being in the game since release (june 2016) and being as oppressive as it has been since release with no nerf in sight I really can't recommend this game to anybody.

Great gameplay with just the right amount of horror themes and jumpscares. Would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys quality gameplay. Also a great team-based game to play with friends or even strangers (from my experience).
